posts.author: yamuchaop
posts.content:
Hmm, it's been a while since i played but i seem to recall the "popular" build pre-HoU was:
Elf Monk - Lawful neutral
Max Dex, High Wis, Some constitution
Feats:
Level 1: Luck of heroes
Level 3: Weapon finesse <--- very important!
Level 6: Weapon focus: Unarmed
Level 9: Toughness
Level 12: Improved critical: Unarmed
Level 15: Blind fight
Level 18: Dodge, or well whatever suits you really

Max out Spellcraft, Tumble (Technically you just need 20 hard points) and Discipline.

PVP'ers picked disarm and improved disarm as i recall it.

It doesn't hit very hard though. Another good option is to make a cleric with 1 level of monk. You can use a full plate, kama and shield. Cast divine power and flurry away. This allows you to be strength based and you get powerful spells like Harm to aid you. It will actually attack faster than the pure monk.

Hail Infra93 and yamuchaop
Cleric and Monk is a nice combo. 
To clarify full plate (or any armor other than robes) and shields will disable the monk abilities however, so for the maximal attacks / round one will want to wear robes and not use a shield. 

Will be good to know what environment you want to play your build in. PvM? PvP? is it low magic or high magic equipment? What sorts of enemies are you facing?

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
That's an interesting observation yamuchaop
Full plate and/or shield should disable the Monk UBAB which is the important one, losing all those attacks / round, Monk AC, Monk Speed and Spell Resistance and Wis AC are other important ones as well.
Less important if you only take a single monk level.
Never thought about flurry though. That is a nice observation and I learned something.
Check the log. Does it say "Your Monk abilities are disabled" or something along those lines? That is more what I meant.
If it does you will know that your monk is not doing as many attacks per rounds as you would like, or have the monk AC / speed bonuses.
